The Dawnsilver Workshop.name: 朝银工坊 The Dawnsilver Workshop
The Dawnsilver Workshop.text:
朝银工坊 The Dawnsilver Workshop

这座已成废墟的朝银工坊，曾是辛-莎拉斯特工匠区众多专注于稀有金属加工的工坊之一，其名称与原主人的信息早已湮没于历史长河之中。它位于星陨之灾中吞噬东部大片城区的巨大熔岩流边缘，如今，唯有工坊的外墙与正门入口仍然可见。其余建筑部分（以及大部分内部空间）均被熔融的岩石掩埋，这些熔融的岩石早已冷却凝固成坚硬的岩石。在索珊女王接管这座城市的统治权后，她与手下开始了长达数月的清理行动，旨在清除潜藏在城市角落中的掠食性怪物与危险隐患，这座工坊也不例外——当时，这里正被一群崇拜恶魔的异界裔邪教徒占据。自邪教徒被击败后，该建筑便不时被其他小型犯罪团伙用作据点或藏身之处，如同工匠区边缘的许多其他建筑一样——至少直到最近，三位一体星的复生者的盟友们选择此处作为他们在辛-尤瑞斯尼亚的秘密行动基地。

这座建筑大部分被掩埋，且位于人口稀疏的城市区域，因此对复生者邪教徒们颇具吸引力。这些邪教徒包括人类法师、强大的罪生怪以及拉米亚，他们由一对危险的搭档领导——拉米亚女族长维辛拉，以及一位数千年未在该地区现身的符文领主——第三位贪婪符文领主吉梅尔。实际上，这并非真正的吉梅尔，而是符文领主赞多古尔通过自创仪式（该仪式可从符文领主残留的遗产中“复生”他们）创造出的活体幻象。该仪式的产物部分涉及复活，但更多地是类似通过@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.h5UqEdeqK8iTcU0J]{阴影二重身 Shadow Double}所创造的生物的虚构造物。关于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fr1AGcQo7WuvLvUi]{复生符文领主 Raise Runelord}仪式及其创造的@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21905advent.JournalEntryPage.05risenrunelor00]{复生符文领主 Risen Runelords}的详细信息，见本卷的@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21905advent]{冒险工具箱 Adventure Toolbox}。

作为首批复生的符文领主之一，吉梅尔对身为符文领主时的过往记忆已十分模糊，更像是幻想而非真实回忆。他对创造者赞多古尔忠心耿耿、坚定不移，但也被这位傲慢符文领主视为其较为“用后即弃”的造物之一，因此值得冒险派往辛-尤瑞斯尼亚执行任务。赞多古尔的计划并不依赖于吉梅尔的生存，因为他和他领导的邪教徒们正等待时机，沐浴即将释放的强大力量，并在赞多古尔采取行动后协助夺取城市控制权。PC们若发现这些邪教徒，便能证明三位一体星的复生者正在活动，并得知有人找到了武器化那些早已死去的符文领主的遗产和残余力量的方法，但他们无法阻止赞多古尔的阴谋。不过，若能击败吉梅尔，他们将能阻止符文领主赞多古尔在即将与索珊的战斗中未能如愿获胜时，利用这位复生的符文领主作为便捷的复活载体。

Dawnsilver Workshop Features.name: 朝银工坊特征 Dawnsilver Workshop Features
Dawnsilver Workshop Features.text:
朝银工坊特征 Dawnsilver Workshop Features

工坊的凿刻石墙在一定程度上抵御了古代熔岩流的侵袭，但其外部木门却未能幸免，熔岩通过门洞涌入，填满了大部分内部空间。这些区域形成了陡峭的熔岩斜坡，相比仍然屹立的加固石墙，更容易攀爬：攀爬熔岩斜坡需要进行一次 @Check[athletics|dc:20|traits:move,skill,action:climb|name:Climb] 检定，而攀爬加固石墙则需要一次 @Check[athletics|dc:30|traits:move,skill,action:climb|name:Climb] 检定。

工坊内部的天花板高度通常为30尺，但在区域 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21901theris.JournalEntryPage.01productstora00]{B2} 以东的区域，天花板高度只有10尺。工坊内部没有照明，不过其中的人类都携带有光源。所有门都由加固木材制成。

Entrance.name: 入口 Entrance
Entrance.text:
B1. 入口 中等威胁 12

一座三十五尺高的建筑矗立在一片古代熔岩流凝固而成的石壳之中，大部分建筑结构已被掩埋。如今，唯有朝银工坊的外墙仍清晰可见，其上立柱被雕刻成类似火焰柱的样式。一个十五尺宽的入口映入眼帘，其门扉早已坍塌成碎石，通向一个宽敞却空荡荡的大厅——这里或许曾是售卖朝银制品的店面，但如今早已被洗劫一空，任何稍有价值的东西都已不复存在。在大厅内部，东侧的四扇大型木门依旧完好无损。

生物： 三位一体星的复生者们深知，无论他们行事多么隐秘，都无法完全掩盖自身存在的痕迹。因此，吉梅尔寻觅到一位自由佣兵，以转移那些在符文领主赞多古尔采取行动前便对废墟产生兴趣之人的注意力，并为其提供保护。他的解决方案是雇佣哈鲁托——一位在此地生活了数十年的雪鬼。与许多盘踞于此的怪物不同，哈鲁托看出了索珊针对这座城市的计划所蕴含的潜力，并轻松转型为受雇于各犯罪帮派的佣兵。过去数年间，哈鲁托已为数十个此类帮派效力——这些帮派或因内耗而衰败，或被敌人击败，但哈鲁托凭借其精明的谈判技巧与善于保持距离的处世之道，总能一次次在最后关头抽身而退，既掩盖了自己的行踪，又通过窃取雇主的部分财物而得以从他们的失败中获利。

起初，哈鲁托只将三位一体星的复生者视为又一个犯罪帮派，并未察觉他们意图背后的真相，也未意识到该帮派首领吉梅尔的神话渊源——在哈鲁托眼中，吉梅尔不过是又一个妄图染指瑟西隆遗产的“冒牌货”。复生者出手阔绰，预先以哈鲁托偏爱的宝石支付了报酬，雇佣他在这座建筑中充当“占据这栋屋子的家伙”，并在他们藏身于建筑更深处时吓退任何靠近者。哈鲁托怀疑这群人是从遥远西部的贝利玛留斯领地流亡而来的法师，他们尚未决定是要公开向索珊女王效忠，还是继续在城市中从事更多犯罪活动，但他们出手大方，所以哈鲁托也懒得在这个问题上深究。

B1. 入口 中等威胁 12

@UUID[Actor.ylSxzduAbHjYtOAs]{哈鲁托 Haruto}

当PC们靠近工坊时，哈鲁托正在里面等候。如果队伍采用潜行方式接近，或者试图在雪鬼夜间熟睡时进入该区域，他们会发现哈鲁托的睡眠极浅。如果他们成功绕过他并深入建筑内部，他不会对战斗的声响做出反应——他受雇看守入口，而非以其他方式协助，但如果他在PC们离开时与他们遭遇，他会要求分走他们从复生者手中夺得的一半物品。

当哈鲁托发现PC们时，他不会立即发动攻击。相反，他会与他们对峙——要么要求他们掉头离开，别打扰他的地盘；要么要求他们提供比复生者更优厚的报酬（至少2000 gp的宝石，之后他会离开），或者承诺将工坊内所得战利品分他一半。如果PC们直接对他发起攻击，这只雪鬼会欣喜地咯咯大笑，毕竟他已经很久没有痛快一战了，但他不会为雇主拼上性命。如果他的生命值降至75点以下，他会施放 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB] 并飞走，撤退至城市周边废墟和洞穴中的他众多藏身处中的一个。他不太可能再回来。

Product Storage.name: 产品储藏室 Product Storage
Product Storage.text:
B2. 产品储藏室 Product Storage

这片大型储物空间被一排排石制货架分隔成多个小区域。虽然这些货架可能曾用于存放待分配物资，但如今上面只剩灰尘和几块破碎的残片。

宝藏： @UUID[Actor.kNePEsXN9lmEXwfQ]{储藏室 Storage}
这些货架早已被洗劫一空，但若PC们肯花半小时仔细搜寻，并通过一次 @Check[perception|dc:30] 检定，仍能发现少许有价值的物品。检定成功者将找到三件标准品质小件朝银制品（一支笔尖、一枚纽扣和一副单片眼镜框），每件价值350 gp，以及一把高等万能钥匙。

Materials Warehouse.name: 材料仓库  Materials Warehouse
Materials Warehouse.text:
B3. 材料仓库 Materials Warehouse 中等威胁 12

这个房间的西半部分，原本可能存放着工坊物资的货架现已空空如也，房间大部分空间被一堵很久以前从南边涌入并已凝固的熔岩墙占据。

B3. 材料仓库 Materials Warehouse 中等威胁 12

@UUID[Actor.8X6Q6uWj1PXfvLqL]{贪婪罪生怪士兵（4） Greedspawn Soldiers}

生物： 四名贪婪罪生怪士兵盘踞在房间的西南部分，他们正为一件部分嵌在熔岩流中的物品争吵不休。这些强大的罪生怪诞生于久远的过去，长期以来一直将符文领主卡祖格视为自己的主人，但他们也在复生的符文领主吉梅尔身上感受到了相似的特质，因此也愿意为他效力。目前，这群家伙正争论着从硬化的熔岩中取出那件宝藏的最好办法。然而，一旦他们发现PC们，争吵便会立刻停止，转而发起攻击。 贪婪罪生怪们会相互配合，协同作战，集中攻击使用小型武器战斗的敌人，试图卸武并夺取这些武器。一旦有贪婪罪生怪夺取到被卸武的武器，便会逃向区域 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21901theris.JournalEntryPage.01workshopunde00]{B4} ，再从B4进入区域 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21901theris.JournalEntryPage.01forge000000000]{B5} ，试图引诱PC们进入东边的陷阱，再与旧工坊中的其他邪教徒会合。除此之外，这些罪生怪会战斗至死。

宝藏： @UUID[Actor.LcjgoZAmqyoGGvJr]{仓库 Warehouse}
贪婪罪生怪们争论的那件物品，是一把+1高等强击 标准品质朝银巨镐，其一部分卡在熔岩之中。一次 @Check[athletics|dc:35|traits:attack,skill,action:force-open|name:Force Open] 检定可以将这把巨镐硬生生拽出来；否则，就需要花费数小时一点一点地凿开硬化的熔岩才能将其取出。

Workshop.name: 工坊 Workshop
Workshop.text:
B4. 工坊 Workshop 中等威胁 12

这座巨大的工坊内，石制立柱支撑着上方三十尺高的拱形屋顶，每根立柱上悬挂的提灯柔和地照亮了整个房间。散布在房间各处的工作台原本可供一小队工匠同时作业，但如今却被用作公共生活区中常见的各种用途——用餐、学习以及娱乐。房间东部地板上铺着几张睡袋，靠近一处被古代熔岩流部分填满的区域。两股熔岩流之间有一处高出地面二十尺的露台俯瞰着整个房间，但原本可能通向此处的楼梯早已被凝固的熔岩掩埋。

生物： 一群加入三位一体星的复生者的低阶信徒居住在这里，他们静待时机，期盼着领袖——复生的符文领主吉梅尔——所承诺的启示与奇迹降临。这些邪教徒由这位复生的符文领主从瑟西隆各地失去信仰、心怀不满的孔雀之灵信徒中秘密招募而来。他们希望失落的神祇早日归来，却对赞多古尔归来的真相一无所知。

B4. 工坊 Workshop 中等威胁 12

@UUID[Actor.JtWRdRoGKivVQXhW]{三位一体信徒 (8) Trinity Initiates}

这些三位一体信徒均身着色彩鲜艳的绿色长袍，并以孔雀羽毛作为饰物——一次 @Check[religion|dc:25|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge] 回忆知识检定可以认出这是早已覆灭的孔雀之灵教派的服饰，该教派在《符文领主的归来》的事件后基本已经解散。袍服与羽毛的破旧褴褛，足见这些邪教徒近期生活困顿，但他们仍对自己的信仰满怀热忱。一旦注意到PC们，他们便会愤怒地尖叫，高呼着“为了复生者！”的战吼发起攻击。他们会与任何从区域 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21901theris.JournalEntryPage.01materialswar00]{B3} 逃至此处的贪婪罪生怪并肩作战。

当仅剩三名三位一体信徒仍能站立时，这些幸存者决定逃往区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21901theris.JournalEntryPage.01officeundefi00]{B7}他们领袖的所在地，并施放 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8] 飞往东侧的露台。若被生擒，邪教徒仍会保持敌对态度且毫不畏惧死亡；但若能迫使他们开口，他们也只会反复宣称孔雀之灵必将如“符文领主吉梅尔所承诺的那样”从灰烬中重生。这些邪教徒对相关阴谋或三位一体星的复生者几乎再无更多可透露的信息（除了承认他们希望尽快被接纳进该组织的行列）。辛-尤瑞斯尼亚的守卫可以从PC们手中接收这些俘虏并带走审判（不过PC们此时尚不知情，随着 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21902flight]{第二章} 的展开，这场审判将永远不会发生）。

Reporting to Sorshen.name: Reporting to Sorshen
Reporting to Sorshen.text:
Reporting to Sorshen

Now that the PCs have witnessed the cult's activity for themselves and have recovered a fair amount of incriminating evidence, they can report to Ayavah about their findings. Ayavah is glad to hear the PCs have found some leads but is alarmed by how far-reaching this cult's influence and aims are. She urges the PCs to come with her to report directly to Runelord Sorshen, the ruler of Eurythnia and warn her of the incoming dangers. With her position as the city's high priestess of @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21904noctic]{Nocticula}, she can arrange a meeting quickly enough but not so swiftly that the PCs don't have time to do some shopping, resting, and recovering if they wish. Once they're ready, Ayavah escorts the party to the Blood Moon Palace.

The Lady of the City.name: The Lady of the City
The Lady of the City.text:
The Lady of the City

When he lived, Runelord Karzoug ruled his city from near the peak of Mhar Massif within the towering Pinnacle of Avarice among the spires of Xin-Shalast. To Queen Sorshen, this felt unnecessarily distant, so she's left those buildings empty and instead chose the city's military academy, Shahlaria, as her home, renaming it the Blood Moon Palace. Constructed (and for many centuries, occupied) by giants, the Blood Moon Palace has a sprawling, intimidating scale that Queen Sorshen's artisans and followers are still working to renovate into something that feels more welcoming and artistic than its previous austere, severe decor.

Scene Notes Ambience

@UUID[Playlist.RN0Zhxpmp9tFJqhO.PlaylistSound.zUcOyapl18JEIqRU]{Blood Moon Palace}

Ayavah leads the PCs quickly through the structure, not pausing as curious artisans (some of whom are giants) look on. She doesn't lead them to the throne room but instead to a sprawling balcony on an upper floor that overlooks the palace courtyard and the city's northern sprawl below. A single guard clad in elegant robes and armed with a guisarme greets the group then cants her head to the side as she receives telepathic instruction from Sorshen to grant Ayavah and the PCs admittance.

The chamber beyond is extravagantly appointed with tapestries, marble statues, fountains, floor-to-ceiling terrariums filled with a wide range of flora and fauna and a wide bathing pool lined with crimson stone. Sorshen herself lounges in a high-backed wood and velvet throne-like chair on the far side of the pool having just concluded a discussion with an immense rime dragon. The dragon nods her head, favors the PCs with an appraising eye, then gracefully exits the area via the open balcony to fly off into the mountains. As the dragon recedes from view, Sorshen bids the PCs and Ayavah approach. Though her expression is soft and welcoming, there's a carefully schooled but unmistakable arrogance in her aura, the kind only one who has held great power can exude. She greets the PCs softly, leaning forward to meet each eye with her cool gaze.

“Welcome, heroes. I've heard you're among the most accomplished of those invited to Xin-Eurythnia in anticipation of our Unveiling Ceremony for the Circle of Open hands. High Priestess Ayavah has spoken highly of you, and it's past time, I think, I made your acquaintance. But those pleasantries, I think, must wait for another time, perhaps after the ceremony. For now, I'm told you have uncovered some unsettling news about a cult?”

In this encounter, the PCs must appeal to Sorshen and convince her of the threat the Risen of the Trinity Star present to the city. This encounter uses the influence rules ( GM Core 187) and is a mythic deed. While the PCs are quite accomplished already and she's heard of their exploits, this is the first time Sorshen's meeting them, so at the same time, the powerful wizard seeks to appraise their own trustworthiness. The fact that Ayavah has vouched for them and that their previous accomplishments are significant results in this influence encounter being somewhat lower level than would be normal for Sorshen, who is a level 23 mythic NPC.

This encounter plays out over the span of an hour, with each round of the encounter taking 15 minutes—the PCs have 4 rounds to complete this encounter.

Queen Sorshen Level 15

  • Unique
  • Medium
  • Human
  • Humanoid
  • Mythic

Powerful ruler and ex-Runelord of Lust

Perception +37

Will +40

Discovery @Check[nocticula-lore|dc:34|traits:concentrate,secret,action:discover|name:Discover], @Check[society|dc:36|traits:concentrate,secret,action:discover|name:Discover], @Check[perception|dc:39|traits:concentrate,secret,action:discover|name:Discover]

Influence Skills @Check[art-lore|dc:34|traits:concentrate,linguistic,action:influence|name:Influence] (to appeal to Sorshen's grown adoration for beautiful artwork), @Check[arcana|dc:36|traits:concentrate,linguistic,action:influence|name:Influence] (to engage with Sorshen as a fellow practitioner of magic), @Check[diplomacy|dc:37|traits:concentrate,linguistic,action:influence|name:Influence], @Check[deception|dc:38|traits:concentrate,linguistic,action:influence|name:Influence], @Check[intimidation|dc:39|traits:concentrate,linguistic,action:influence|name:Influence]

Influence 4 Sorshen believes there's some merit to the PCs' concerns and promises to look into it. She also promises to spread the word among the city that the PCs are true heroes of Xin-Eurythnia.

Influence 6 @UUID[Actor.44iMDwRTf8V8ZdQg]{Sorshen's Influence Gift}
Sorshen gives the PCs' her backing to keep investigating. She also asks the PCs to consider themselves as honorary guards for the Unveiling Ceremony—each PC who agrees is given a greater Sihedron medallion . A PC who wears this medallion openly during the Unveiling Ceremony events gains a +2 item bonus to all Diplomacy and Intimidation checks (@UUID[Item.x2yTqKjWwDgwYZv1]{Displayed Authority}).

Influence 8 Sorshen is convinced that the cult is a serious threat and increases security at the Unveiling Ceremony, which affords the PCs additional allies during @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21901theris.JournalEntryPage.01event5devast00]{Event 5}.

Influence 10 @UUID[Actor.0tdG8JwGiRPlH0aF]{Sorshen's Influence Gift}
Sorshen is impressed by the PCs. In addition to repeating her desire to meet with them for a more in-depth discussion about their future role in Xin-Eurythnia, she gives each of them a greater Sihedron ring as a gift.

Resistances Sorshen has worked hard to reinvent herself and leave behind the more cruel aspects of her personality and is annoyed when anyone makes assumptions about her intentions. If a PC calls her a runelord at any time, increase all Influence check DCs for that PC by 1. If a PC openly questions Sorshen's motives or implies that she's evil, increase those checks' DCs by 2.

Weaknesses Sorshen loathes the legacy of the original runelords, and news about runelords coming back disturbs her and makes her more eager to work with the PCs. If the PCs tell her about risen Runelord Gimmel (or at the very least describe the man to her, at which point she recognizes him and reveals this fact to the PCs), reduce all DCs to influence her by 2.

Background During her rule eons ago, Sorshen committed many cruelties, but she's seen what rewards her fellow runelords reaped in the modern area. Today, she's committed to changing herself and New Thassilon for the better, she hopes to represent true repentance and make her nation a safe haven for those who have suffered because of people like her past self.

Appearance A beautiful woman in a luxurious gown, with long black hair and armed with an elegant guisarme.

Personality introspective, calculating, confident

Treasure: In addition to any gifts of magic items or treasure the PCs earn by influencing Sorshen, if she learns about the documents the PCs recovered from area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21901theris.JournalEntryPage.01officeundefi00]{B7}, she offers to purchase them for 150% their value—975 gp.

Concluding the Meeting.name: Concluding the Meeting
Concluding the Meeting.text:
Concluding the Meeting

Once the meeting with Sorshen ends (either as a result of reaching an hour or the PCs achieving Influence 12), she thanks the PCs for their service. She has some last-minute work to ensure that the Circle of Open Hands functions as intended, work which must be done from within the Eye of Desire (her personal demiplane accessed from the Runewell of Lust), and makes plans to meet with the PCs again a few days after the Unveiling Ceremony takes place. Of course, events will conspire to prevent this meeting from ever occurring, but for now, the PCs should have some time to rest—once you decide it's time to continue the campaign, proceed with “The Unveiling Ceremony.”

Reward: Influencing Sorshen is a mythic deed—if the PCs achieved at least Influence 8 with her, restore 3 Mythic Points to each PC. In addition, for each tier of influence the PCs achieve, grant them 30 XP, for a full 120 XP if they reach Influence 10.

The Unveiling Ceremony.name: The Unveiling Ceremony
The Unveiling Ceremony.text:
The Unveiling Ceremony

The day of the Unveiling Ceremony sees the city of Xin-Eurythnia embrace a festive air. Most of the city's populace travels north to gather in Temple Plaza in the Entertainment District. A large, colorful tent has stood at the center of this plaza for months, obscuring the view of the Circle of Open Hands portal so that it can be unveiled to the public with proper pomp and circumstance. The surrounding plaza and nearby streets teem with vendors, games, and entertainment of all types. The Unveiling Ceremony is scheduled to occur at sundown, but the festivities start at dawn—the PCs should have plenty of time to wander the streets, shop, and partake in some fun distractions, but during the day, three more complex events occur in their vicinity.

Scene Notes Ambience

@UUID[Playlist.RN0Zhxpmp9tFJqhO.PlaylistSound.euv0XpmRpxRMP1KO]{The Unveiling Ceremony}

Obstacles.name: Obstacles
Obstacles.text:
Obstacles

Each infiltration round is 10 minutes of in-world time.

Outer Defenses Obstacle

Infiltration Points 2 (group)

Overcome @Check[stealth|dc:32] (to sneak by the traps) or @Check[arcana|dc:35] (to recognize magical sensors and avoid triggering the defenses).

The outer chambers feature several simple, non-lethal magical traps that nonetheless must be navigated.

The Bemused Artist Obstacle

Infiltration Points 3 (group)

Overcome @Check[thievery|dc:32] (to disarm the traps) or @Check[fortitude|dc:35] (to resist trap effects).

The entrance to the east wing is warded by magical paintings of artists that, when triggered, attempt to petrify intruders by transforming them into stone statues.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point as normal, and the PC who rolled the failure becomes partially petrified, increasing their clumsy condition value by 1. This condition value persists until the end of the infiltration (and is treated as a 12th level effect for the purposes of counteracting it with a spell like sure footing). If multiple failures result in this value reaching clumsy 3, the PC is turned to stone permanently, as if via a petrify spell (@UUID[Item.8DJe6VsBys7rjxqg]{Partial Petrification}).

Critical Failure As failure, but the clumsy condition value increases by 2, and the party accrues 2 Awareness Points.

Dancing Sentries Obstacle

Infiltration Points 3 (group)

Overcome @Check[athletics|dc:32] (to force your way through) or @Check[performance|dc:35] (to anticipate the dancing sentries' programming and avoid them).

Pelthia's cries for help draw the PCs into a gallery defended by a group of defensive constructs built to resemble dancing aristocrats. These sentries do their best to restrain the PCs; while the sentries individually are no real challenge, the number makes this a significant obstacle.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points, and the PC who rolled the critical failure takes @Damage[(3d10+6)[bludgeoning]] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save) from the constructs.

Rescuing Pelthia Obstacle

Infiltration Points 2 (group)

Overcome @Check[thievery|dc:32] (to dismantle parts of the cage) or @Check[athletics|dc:35] (to break off portions of the cage).

Pelthia has become trapped in a complex clockwork cage that holds her tight.

Ending the Infiltration.name: Ending the Infiltration
Ending the Infiltration.text:
Ending the Infiltration

Once the infiltration ends, either because the PCs completed all four obstacles or the authorities arrived to finish the job, Pelthia is shaken but grateful. Whether or not Kalden's role is revealed or goes unnoticed depends on the PCs, but ultimately, the events of the next several hours render it largely moot. However, if they keep quiet, he gives them the eye of apprehension in thanks (@UUID[Actor.3wONQgFdV2uhxYaa]{Kalden's Reward}).

If the PCs rescued Pelthia without the authorities getting involved, she's grateful enough to reward them with a set of standard-grade elven chain and a dawnsilver and jade necklace worth 400 gp (@UUID[Actor.ybiBB0jfYGcG9BqQ]{Pelthia's Reward}).

Reward: If the PCs attempted the infiltration, grant them 20 XP for each obstacle they overcome. Overcoming them all also grants each PC 1 Mythic Point for the legendary accomplishment.

Event 5: Devastation.name: Event 5: Devastation
Event 5: Devastation.text:
Event 5. Devastation Severe 12

As the sun sets, festivalgoers head toward Temple Plaza, gathering in a ring around the plaza's boundaries while keeping the central area open—here, the large, colorful tent that's obscured the Circle of Open Hands portal is scheduled to come down as Queen Sorshen activates a permanent magical link between Xin-Eurythnia and Absalom. The ceremony begins but is quickly interrupted by unexpected visitors.

As sun sets, Queen Sorshen appears in the air, flying above the tent. She speaks to the gathered crowd in a voice magically augmented so that all can hear and understand in their native languages:

Scene Notes Macro

@UUID[Macro.tIGcyD3rBydmGKmB]{Remove Tent} @UUID[Macro.fH7jvf1TrbMpzEM7]{Open Sinkhole} @UUID[Macro.b3f97aKeVqvVYD16]{Reset Plaza}

“Welcome, citizens of Xin-Eurythnia and honored guests alike! Thank you for graciously attending the inaugural activation of the Circle of Open Hands, the key to Xin-Eurythnia's next step in becoming better friends and allies to the world. Behold our future!”

With that, she reaches down to grasp the highest flapping banner above the tent, then rises upward swiftly into the air, pulling the entire tent up and off the ground in one fluid motion. The tent fades away as mist in a high wind, revealing the Circle of Open Hand portal at the plaza's center—an enormous circular archway nearly forty feet in diameter. Its intricate frame of metal and stone is shaped to resemble multiple figures of different ancestries holding their hands out to one another. The pair at the very top smile radiantly as they clasp hands held high in an arch above the portal below—these two figures depict Queen Sorshen and the goddess Nocticula.

Cheers resound at the reveal. Sorshen smiles at the enthusiasm and floats back down when suddenly, the earth rumbles. Before anyone can react, three simultaneous events occur in rapid succession:

  • A rippling wave of energy washes over the entire region, bringing with it a moment of sharp pain. This does no lasting damage, but a PC who succeeds at a @Check[arcana|dc:31|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge], @Check[nature|dc:31|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge], @Check[occultism|dc:31|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge], or @Check[religion|dc:31|traits:concentrate,secret,skill,action:recall-knowledge|name:Recall Knowledge] check to Recall Knowledge realizes that this wave of energy was some sort of immense interdimensional shock wave. A critical success suggests this shock wave may have temporarily rendered teleportation magic unreliable or worse (see @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21902flight.JournalEntryPage.02dimensionald00]{Dimensional Damage} for more details).
  • High up near the peak of Mhar Massif above the city, Karzoug's carved face cracks and begins to crumble, tumbling down the mountainside. A PC who succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:30] check notices this as it occurs; others only realize it once the thunderous sound of the landslide reaches the city about 10 seconds later. The landslide smashes into the Spires of Xin-Shalast and destroys the Pinnacle of Avarice, once Karzoug's palace, creating a blinding flash of magical energy that, for a moment, lights the entire city up as if it were high noon.
  • A spiderweb of fractures radiates outward across Temple Plaza from the center, where the Circle of Open Hands portal stands. A moment later, a sinkhole opens in the middle of the plaza, consuming the portal with a roar as the forty-foot-tall structure collapses into the newly formed fifty-foot-diameter pit. From below, a deafening trumpeting sound rises up.

Screams rip through the gathered crowd as people panic and begin to flee Temple Plaza, while Sorshen, who hadn't quite touched down, now floats over a vast pit. As plumes of dust and smoke rise up around her, the hazy image of a vast elephantine shape with glowing violet eyes and six immense tusks looms over the plaza. Floating in the air before the shape, right between those eyes, is a humanoid shape. Sorshen gasps as she looks upward, then cries out, “You? How can it be you?” before a torrential wind vacuum threatens to pull much of northern Xin-Eurythnia into the depths. Sorshen throws wide her arms to counter this potent magic, and a moment later the wind lessens… then draws the elephantine shape, its humanoid attendant, and Sorshen herself down into the depths. A moment later, the sound of an impossibly large set of doors slamming shut sends another tremor through the city.

All PCs at this time must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save to resist being knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} by the blast of wind. A PC who critically fails at this is pulled closer to the pit, although not into it. The blast of wind ceases as quickly as it came, and the air fills with the people's screams and distant rumbling of the immense landslide at the peak of Mhar Massif. Much closer to the PCs, the sonorous shrieks of two immense birdlike monstrosities ring out as the creatures surge up and out of the pit, landing along the edge on seven long spindly legs.

The PCs have just witnessed Runelord Xanderghul's triumphant first attack on the world as, deep below Xin-Eurythnia, he forced open a hidden, immense portal to Jandelay—one of the Doomsday Doors : one of the artifacts created long ago by the followers of the god of the end times, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.WloVxo6HXJdS4YTt]{Groetus}. Xanderghul's attempt to deal more damage was thwarted by Queen Sorshen, but she paid for her interference by being pulled into Jandelay. Her sacrifice has closed the Doomsday Door and given her people time to flee the devastation.

A PC who succeeds at a @Check[perception|dc:32] check gets a better glimpse at the figures in the smoke, and with a @Check[arcana|dc:25] check can identify the elephantine shape as the legendary Oliphaunt of Jandelay, a monstrous creature said to visit worlds on the eves of their destruction, and who was momentarily conjured during the height of ancient Thassilon to repel an invading army from Azlant. A critical success on this Arcana check also allows the PCs to identify the mist-hidden figure that floated between the Oliphaunt's eyes as Runelord Xanderghul—or at least, a realistic illusion of him.

The sinkhole itself connected, for a moment, to a Darklands cavern many hundreds of feet below, but collapsed in on itself swiftly, leaving behind a 100-foot-deep pit in which bits and pieces of the twisted, destroyed Circle of Open Hands portal lie strewn.

Creatures: The two monsters that emerge from the pit are erons of Jandelay, immense scavengers from that distant and mysterious realm who managed to fly through the Doomsday Doors before Sorshen slammed them shut on her passage through them. The two creatures immediately set to the task of strutting and flapping through the plaza, picking up lumps of fallen masonry to inspect them before casting them aside, as if searching for valuables.

Event 5. Devastation Severe 12

@UUID[Actor.XZm7FvhP99BEfK2M]{Erons of Jandelay (2)}

Use the Destroyed Plaza scene for this encounter. The PCs can place themselves anywhere within 15 feet of the scene's outer edge, unless they were pulled toward the pit, in which case they may place themselves anywhere in the plaza that's between 15 feet from the outer edge and 30 feet from the sinkhole's edge. The two erons of Jandelay begin at points you select no further than 30 feet from the sinkhole's edge and swiftly turn their attention to the PCs, their glittering eyes already appraising their gear as potential prizes.

A fight against these two mythic creatures is a dangerous battle for the PCs, who hopefully haven't squandered their resources and Mythic Points on the festival's earlier events! The monsters attack at once, confident in their abilities, but as soon as one of the two erons is defeated, the other realizes the danger and attempts to flee back into the pit through the Doomsday Doors , only to find rubble choking the way. The eron continues to lurk and hide in the sinkhole's depths, and if the PCs confront it again there, it fights to the death.

Additional Guards.name: Additional Guards
Additional Guards.text:
Additional Guards

If the PCs achieved at least 8 Influence with Sorshen earlier, she posts frost giants in the plaza (a total of one per PC) as additional guards. These giants can aid the PCs in the fight against the erons—give each player control of one @UUID[Actor.QJNTvcCcQhOwplRr]{Frost Giant} that they can run in the battle.

Running This Chapter.name: Running This Chapter
Running This Chapter.text:
Running This Chapter

This chapter presents the PCs with an unusual challenge, one suited toward heroes of their mythic stature—the organization and execution of a city-wide evacuation through some of the most inhospitable terrain in the Saga Lands. During the first half, the PCs work to gather support in the city, bolster the morale of its citizens, and prepare for the journey south. During the second half, they'll command this exodus, leading the citizens of Xin-Eurythnia south to the smaller city of Vekker's Crossing in the foothills of the Kodar Mountains.

Note that no complete scene of the route between Xin-Eurythnia and Vekker's Crossing is provided, as the journey is presented in episodic fashion.

Evacuation Preparation.name: Evacuation Preparation
Evacuation Preparation.text:
Evacuation Preparation

Where's Sorshen?

Word of Sorshen's disappearance spreads quickly through the refugees, and it's not long before conflicting rumors arise. Some claim that Sorshen was slain during the events of Doom's Night, others fear she's abandoned the city, and more than a few spread conspiracies that the destruction of her rival's home was her plan all along. None, including the PCs (who witnessed her vanishing), know the truth—that the queen was drawn into the demiplane of Jandelay through the Doomsday Doors before the doors slammed shut and became buried under rubble.

Ayavah tries not to let the rumors get to her and advises the PCs to do the same—there's more immediate concerns to focus on. What happened to Queen Sorshen can be put off for a later day, if she doesn't return with an explanation before then!

During the week after Doom's Night, the PCs may use the following downtime activities to earn bonus Supply Points. Each downtime activity has different skill checks that can be attempted, but a creative PC might find other ways to achieve the same effect. A creative solution, casting a spell that expends a spell slot, or expending a resource should reduce the DC of the check by 2 or more at the GM's discretion.

Note that two of these activities (Fortify Shelters and Oppose the Risen) are particularly important. If these activities are not attempted at all on any given day, the activity's critical failure result automatically takes place.

Each of the following activities can only be pursued once per day by the party. If your group has more than four PCs, those without an Evacuation Preparation option can instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} (although in both cases, any DC associated with these activities is increased by 5 as a result of the dire situation).

The first time a PC achieves a critical success at one of the following activities, that PC earns 1 Mythic Point for the legendary accomplishment; this can happen only once per activity for the party.

Fortify Shelters

  • Downtime
  • Manipulate

You help to reinforce barriers, build fortifications, secure defensive barricades, and guide those in need to a safe place to spend the day. Attempt a @Check[crafting|dc:31] or @Check[survival|dc:31] check.

Critical Success The shelters automatically provide protection on the following day without needing to perform this activity.

Success The shelters remain functional during the day.

Failure The shelters begin to fail. Attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. On a failure, lose 1 Survival Point.

Critical Failure The shelters fail dramatically. Lose 1 Survival Point.

Special If no PC attempts this activity on a day without a previous day's critical success, then the critical failure effect occurs automatically.

Comfort and Protect

  • concentrate
  • Downtime

You soothe concerns, tend wounds, work to keep troublemakers in line, or bolster morale with entertainment, all while spreading the word about the coming need for an evacuation, in hopes of allowing the refugees more time to prepare for the upcoming journey. Attempt a @Check[diplomacy|dc:31], @Check[intimidation|dc:31], @Check[medicine|dc:31], or @Check[performance|dc:31] check.

Critical Success The party earns 2 Supply Points.

Success The party earns 1 Supply Point.

Critical Failure Your attempts backfire badly enough that some of the goodwill and trust that's been building erodes—the party loses 1 Supply Point.

Oppose the Risen

  • concentrate
  • Downtime

Without risen Runelord Gimmel to organize and compel cooperation, the remaining Risen of the Trinity Star cultists hiding in the city are disorganized, yet still dangerous. Attempt a @Check[religion|dc:31], @Check[stealth|dc:31] check, or a weapon or spell Strike against AC 33.

Critical Success The PC opposes the Risen in a public way that not only prevents any casualties among the refugees, but earns the party 1 Supply Point in the form of gear and other materials recovered from the Risen. In addition, the PC recovers 600 gp worth of Common consumable items of the player's choice (subject to the GM's approval).

Success As critical success, but no Supply Points are earned.

Failure The party prevents the loss of any Survival Points, but fail to recover any supplies or consumables.

Critical Failure While you prevent some of the mayhem, the Risen still manage to engineer the deaths or conversion of many refugees. The Eurythnians lose 1 Survival Point.

Special If no PC attempts this activity, by the end of the day, the Eurythnians automatically lose 1d4 Survival Points as the cultists murder some, convert others, and encourage dangerous creatures from the caverns below to come up to the city to hunt.

Scavenge Supplies

  • Downtime
  • Manipulate

You search for supplies by squeezing through narrow areas, pushing aside heavy rubble, disarming malfunctioning security features, or simply keeping a keen eye out. Attempt a @Check[acrobatics|dc:31], @Check[athletics|dc:31], @Check[perception|dc:31], or @Check[thievery|dc:31] check.

Critical Success The party earns 2 Supply Points.

Success The party earns 1 Supply Point.

Failure The PC discovers nothing of use.

Critical Failure Your search infringes on the property of survivors, who don't take kindly to your “looting.” Increase the DC for all future Scavenge Supplies checks by 1 each time this occurs.

Reward: At the end of each day, if the party accrued at least 2 successes or 1 critical success at any of the above five activities, grant the PCs 40 XP.

The Eurythnians.name: The Eurythnians
The Eurythnians.text:
The Eurythnians

The Eurythnians number about 10,000, a mass of desperate travelers represented somewhat abstractly by Survival Points. Initially, the Eurythnians have 100 Survival Points, but various failures and missed opportunities during the earlier parts of this chapter may have already decreased this value. The more Survival Points the PCs can keep by the time they reach the end of the chapter, the greater their reward and the more Eurythnians they save.

In addition, the Eurythnians start the evacuation with 10 Supply Points. Increase this starting number as appropriate for any successes the PCs had during the previous week. Every day of travel, the Eurythnians consume 1 Supply Point, either as the refugees consume them or as they're forced to leave supplies behind as a result of dwindling survivors.

The evacuation plays out using the infiltration subsystem (GM Core 196), during which the PCs must overcome the following group obstacles in order. For flavor, Infiltration Points in this encounter are referred to as Evacuation Points. Now and then, play shifts from the infiltration rules to encounter-based play, as detailed in specific obstacles. Remember that PCs can always choose to skip a roll to avoid potentially accruing more Awareness Points on their turns. Alternatively, a PC can choose to pursue the @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21901theris.JournalEntryPage.01opportunity000]{Support your Allies} opportunity to try to earn the group Edge Points rather than to help overcome the current obstacle.

Each round of evacuation encompasses 1 day of in-world time. At the start of each round, the Eurythnians expend 1 Supply Point. Each time an evacuation round begins with no Supply Points available to spend, the Eurythnians lose [[/r 1d10]] Survival Points. The first time a PC achieves a critical success at one of the following obstacles, that PC earns 1 Mythic Point for the legendary accomplishment; this can happen only once per obstacle for the party.

Leaving Xin-Eurythnia Obstacle

Evacuation Points 3 (group)

Overcome @Check[mountain-lore|dc:31] to prepare large groups of people for travel through high altitudes without magic protection, @Check[society|dc:33] to anticipate the group's fears and needs, @Check[will|dc:36] to keep your composure and maintain a brave exterior in order to give the Eurythnians a true leader to follow.

The PCs gather the Eurythnians up and organize the exodus from Xin-Eurythnia, leading a frightened mass of thousands of people south into the cold, thin air, even as small tremors, minor avalanches, and whispers of strange creatures watching from nearby mountaintops plague the people.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points.

Recent Avalanche Obstacle

Evacuation Points 2 (group)

Overcome @Check[mountain-lore|dc:31] to navigate the debris, @Check[athletics|dc:33] to perform incredible feats of strength to clear the way, @Check[perception|dc:36] to notice hidden but safe paths through the area.

A recent avalanche blocks the route on this day, forcing either a detour or a lot of hard work to clear the path forward.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points. The first time a PC critically succeeds at this obstacle, they uncover an unfortunate merchant caravan that was caught in the avalanche. While there were no survivors, the PCs can recover 2 Supply Points worth of food and items from the site.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point. The Eurythnians lose 1 Survival Point as a cave-in caused by the unstable ground claims dozens of lives.

Fen of the Icemists Obstacle

Evacuation Points 3 (group)

Overcome @Check[nature|dc:31] to protect the Eurythnians from Svevenka's primal magic, @Check[diplomacy|dc:33] to convince Svevenka that no one will enter the fen and that the refugees will be out of her sight by nightfall, @Check[stealth|dc:36] to direct large numbers of Eurythnians through the area without attracting any attention at all.

The evacuation passes one of the most infamous landmarks in the high Kodars: the legendary Fen of the Icemists. This frozen swampland serves as the home of a capricious fey creature, a powerful naiad queen druid named Svevenka. Already distressed by eruption of Mhar Massif and worried about the strange fluctuations in the region's primal magic, Svevenka reacts poorly to the incursion of an entire city population along the western edges of her domain and confronts the evacuees with harrowing primal magic and threats.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points. The first time a PC gets this result, many of the evacuees flee in terror from Svevenka's magic. That PC immediately face the Disaster! complication (page 41) to determine the results of this panic.

Special @UUID[Actor.o7bEVo4iU7QwBOtZ]{Svevenka's Gift}
Once the PCs overcome this obstacle, Svevenka takes some time to warn the PCs that “something” is wrong. She has no new information for the PCs, but if they fill her in on recent events in Xin-Eurythnia, she's astounded and shocked, and gives the party two gifts help them continue on their way south: a major water elemental fragment and a tidal crossbow. crossbow

Risen Saboteurs Obstacle

Evacuation Points 2 (group)

Overcome @Check[thievery|dc:31] to notice the sabotage attempts and defeat them before they become a problem, @Check[crafting|dc:33] to quickly and efficiently repair any damage done, @Check[intimidation|dc:36] to foster a presence that makes even the act of sabotage against the evacuees too dangerous for the Risen to contemplate.

Some of those who evacuated with the rest are secretly followers of the Risen of the Trinity Star, and their attempts to sabotage the escape begin to make themselves known as wagons begin to falter, survival gear is discovered to be damaged or ruined, and most disturbingly, an unexpected shortage in food supplies that results in a potential loss of 4 Supply Points.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points and gains 1 Supply Point as material previously thought ruined turns out to still be usable (this is in addition to the 4 points the PCs can recover when this obstacle is overcome).

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point and loses 1 Supply Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points and loses 2 Supply Points.

Special @UUID[Actor.CxbgEk157MpXc6yW]{Saboteur's Treasures}
Once the PCs overcome this obstacle, the Risen saboteurs flee into the wilderness when it's apparent they're about to be caught. The PCs (or an ally) discover evidence they left behind that helps to ensure guards can keep a more watchful eye, but more importantly, the Risen's panicked flight forced them to leave behind two valuable treasures: a 6th-rank wand of veil of privacy and a type IV spacious pouch containing the missing food (this restores the 4 Supply Points thought lost as this obstacle begins).

Nightmare Rumors Obstacle

Evacuation Points 3 (group)

Overcome @Check[occultism|dc:31] to realize the nightmares are growing and take steps to guard against them, @Check[performance|dc:33] to keep the refugees entertained and morale high in the face of these developments, @Check[deception|dc:36] to spread countering (if fabricated) rumors that work to keep refugees distracted.

The source of the unsettling nightmares the PCs have been enduring (@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21902flight.JournalEntryPage.02supernatural00]{See Here}) start to bleed over into reality, with more and more Eurythnians starting to complain about feelings of impending doom, whispering about sightings of strange distorted monsters, or spreading rumors that the PCs don't actually know where they're going and are willfully leading everyone to a frozen death.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points. The first time a PC achieves a critical success at overcoming this obstacle, they discover evidence that the source of these nightmares is nearby, granting them an advantage during @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21902flight.JournalEntryPage.02event7nightm00]{Event 7}.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points, and the Eurythnians lose 1 Survival Point as several dozen refugees are discovered to have gone missing, having abandoned the larger group for fear of these visions to make an ill-advised and ultimately lethal attempt to seek salvation in the wilderness.

Special Run @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21902flight.JournalEntryPage.02event7nightm00]{Event 7} after the PCs overcome this obstacle.

Harrowing Storm Obstacle

Evacuation Points 2 (group)

Overcome @Check[crafting|dc:31] to swiftly construct shelters for the Eurythnians most at risk, @Check[nature|dc:33] to use primal magic to fight against the storm, @Check[medicine|dc:36] to provide aid to help those injured or otherwise impacted by the storm recover swiftly.

A sudden windstorm develops into an unexpected blizzard that reduces forward progress to a crawl, but perhaps worse are the unsettling howls and strange whispers people hear in the winds that threaten to frighten refugees into fatal runs into the wilds.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points but also manages to secure more shelter against the storm. Reduce all Survival Point losses accrued for the remainder of this round by 1.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point and loses 1 Survival Point from victims to the storm.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points and loses 2 Survival Points from victims to the storm.

Missing Eurythnians Obstacle

Evacuation Points 3 (group)

Overcome @Check[acrobatics|dc:31] to take to the air to search for the missing from above (this requires at least one PC to be able to fly), @Check[survival|dc:33] to track the missing Eurythnians and rescue them, @Check[nature|dc:36] to use primal magic to converse with the spirits of the land to locate the missing.

Several dozen refugees have gone missing. Tracks leading off into the snow suggest that a large group may have decided to try their own luck in finding their way to safety.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points. If any Survival Points have been lost as a result of this Obstacle, the PCs recover 1 Survival Point as a group of missing Eurythnians thought lost forever are found frightened but alive, huddling in a cave.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point and loses 1 Survival Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points and loses 2 Survival Points.

Oversized Bandits Obstacle

Evacuation Points 2 (group)

Overcome @Check[intimidation|dc:31] to make the Eurythnians look more dangerous, @Check[stealth|dc:33] to move ahead of the main body of the refugees to ambush the giants before they attack, weapon or spell Strike against AC 36 to deal overwhelming blows against the bandits during the ambushes.

As the evacuees pass into lower elevations, the easier march is offset by the increased activity of dangerous monsters and predators, including an organized band of bitter stone giants known as the Kodar Kings who have long preyed upon the route as bandits.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point and loses 1 Survival Point and 1 Supply Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points and loses 2 Survival Points and 2 Supply Points.

Special @UUID[Actor.XmO5IAcngBsoQaQp]{Bandit's Supplies}
Once the PCs overcome this obstacle, a search of the ambush points and the stone giant leaders who fell in battle allows the party to potentially recover some supplies. Each PC can attempt a @Check[perception|dc:33] check to gain 1 Supply Point (or 2 Supply Points on a critical success) by spending time looking through the bandits' equipment and supplies—up to 4 Supply Points can be gained by the PCs in this way. In addition, the PCs recover a +2 Greater Striking Keen Scimitar one of the giants wore on a leather cord as a trophy and a grimy Wand of Chain Lightning another giant used as a toothpick.

Frayed Nerves Obstacle

Evacuation Points 3 (group)

Overcome @Check[performance|dc:31] to lift spirits by producing a concert or play or other distraction, @Check[religion|dc:33] to lead the faith-minded Eurythnians in prayer, @Check[crafting|dc:36] to take part in preparing food and use creative ingenuity to turn the normal fare into an unexpectedly tasty banquet.

While the end of the evacuation is in sight, the evacuees are growing restless and exhausted, and tempers are flaring. If it's before round 9 of the Evacuation, the PCs' speed has helped keep these tensions from rising too much—reduce all DCs to overcome this Obstacle by 2.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points and loses 1 Supply Point as a side effect of wastage

Dragon Sightings Obstacle

Evacuation Points 2 (group)

Overcome @Check[arcana|dc:31] to identify the mirage dragons and know how to prepare for a possible confrontation, @Check[deception|dc:33] to distract the Eurythnians from the sightings to keep fear from spreading, @Check[diplomacy|dc:36] to keep the Eurythnians' hopes high and to minimize the effects of the sightings.

An increasing number of “dragon sightings” are reported, and fear begins to spread through the refugees.

Critical Success The party gains 2 Evacuation Points. If at least one PC achieves a critical success at this obstacle, they gain a +2 circumstance bonus on initiative checks during @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21902flight.JournalEntryPage.02event8return00]{Event 8}.

Success The party gains 1 Evacuation Point.

Failure The party accrues 1 Awareness Point.

Critical Failure The party accrues 2 Awareness Points.

Special Run @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap21902flight.JournalEntryPage.02event8return00]{Event 8} after this obstacle.

Conclusions.name: Conclusions
Conclusions.text:
Conclusions

As the PCs reach Vekker's Crossing, they're met by the city's leaders who welcome the tired Eurythnians into their town. While Vekker's Crossing is far too small to comfortably house thousands of refugees, the locals have spent the past several days preparing tents and shelters in the surrounding flatlands to give the weary evacuees a place to rest in comfort for a few nights, and the city's food stores have been opened to supply hungry mouths. The next several weeks will be exhausting and complicated as the refugees settle into the area or split off to make much safer journeys along trade routes through the Storval Plateau to other safe havens, but the PCs' direct responsibility ends here. Ayavah, along with other leaders like Jatheriel, Sonrasi, and Vokshar, take it upon themselves to see to the safety of the Eurythnians, for the PCs have a meeting with a dragon to attend. More importantly, as Ayavah notes, these “risen runelords” and their cult represent a serious threat to the region. If they can wreak as much havoc as they did in Xin-Eurythnia anywhere else, they must be stopped. But simply determining what they want is important as well. She fully expects the PCs must travel soon to confront the cult in their headquarters and promises to not only make sure the Eurythnians are cared for but notes that the PCs can contact her whenever they wish via spells like sending if they have news or want updates.

Scene Notes Ambience

At about the same time, news that the regional distortions to teleportation effects have faded comes to light. Ayavah and Jatheriel both interpret this as a hopeful sign, that whatever the Risen of the Trinity Star are up to, their plans have not yet progressed to a point where they're affecting things on a permanent basis.

The PCs can spend as much time as they wish in the settlement of Vekker's Crossing to rest, recover, and shop before they head up to their meeting with the mysterious omen dragon Kandirvek.
