Ayavah.name: Ayavah
Ayavah.text:
Ayavah Renowned Sculptor and Priestess

Ayavah's very first memories are of life in a Magnimarian orphanage near the seedy Underbridge district, recollections that ensure she's no stranger to feeling unwanted. She quickly learned that there were few who would help a young girl on the streets—let alone an entire building of needy children. Moreover, though the city was harsh to all orphans, it proved harshest to those who didn't fit in. As an intersex youth, Ayavah soon learned to disguise herself in makeup and wear padded clothing. Born with obvious signs of demonic heritage, she learned how to file her horns down to stubs and how to wear baggy gloves to conceal the sixth finger on each of her hands, passing as a human to avoid the judgment of others.

After she aged out of the orphanage, Ayavah found support and comfort by flitting from cult to cult, selling small idols and trinkets she sculpted to get by. Though she found camaraderie in these various groups, she never found real acceptance. When she joined the Cult of the Redeemer Queen, it seemed at first like just another group she would soon lose interest in. But one night, Ayavah was struck awake by the vision of a beautiful woman and, as if entranced, began to work on a new sculpture. When the first light of dawn broke the dark of the sky, she found that she'd sculpted the image of a succubus with large bat wings open in gentle embrace rather than seduction. Ayavah instantly recognized her creation as a depiction of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.deities.Item.jL1qiVOZBKXETtVD]{Nocticula} and took it as a divine sign to commit herself to the Redeemer Queen—an at-the-time heretical sect that regarded the then-demon lord of assassins, darkness, and lust as something more.

The once-forlorn sculptor found salvation from her fear and self-loathing through her faith. She dedicated her nights to art and her days to uplifting the version of Nocticula she worshipped. Ayavah quickly rose in prominence as an artist and found great status in the relationships she built through her art. Her most famous work is a group of sculptures featuring succubi, a deeply personal portrayal of her devotion and the solace she found in Nocticula. Though she faced scorn, treachery, and violence from many of Nocticula's more traditionalist worshippers, who favored the demon lord's violent aspects, Ayavah's unrelenting faith in Nocticula's nature as a muse and protector was rewarded when the demon lord fully abandoned her cruel ways in favor of showing mercy toward the weak.

Nocticula's influence in her life drastically strengthened Ayavah's sense of self-worth. She now proudly shows her horns, adorning them with jewelry and wearing her hair in styles that accentuate the signs of her demonic heritage. Her makeup, once used to disguise, has become a tool to celebrate. Knowing the pain of rejection and loneliness, Ayavah is fiercely devoted to those considered outsiders and has helped others learn to love and accept their differences, teaching that all have a place under the Redeemer Queen's shadow. She especially looks out for those othered due to mixed ancestries, as is sometimes the case for nephilim, aiuvarins, and dromaars.

A rising figure among the faith, Ayavah is the current head of Midnight's Gallery, the Cathedral of Nocticula in Xin-Eurythnia. She often travels to other cities to seek out those looking for sanctuary and acceptance. Despite her unpleasant childhood, she holds overall fond memories of her hometown of Magnimar, as it was there that she first heard Nocticula's call. Ayavah has trekked many times to lead outcasts from other nations into Xin-Eurythnia, helping them to start anew and find a community who embraces them.

Campaign Role

Ayavah serves as a local friend and ally to the PCs. While she doesn't lend direct aid in combat, her role as the head of Midnight's Gallery and her reputation as a community leader lends her social power and knowledge that helps the PCs understand the inner workings of Xin-Eurythnia. When calamity strikes, Ayavah becomes an important representative of the city, advising and aiding the PCs as they work to protect and defend the citizens on the dangerous journey to the safety of Vekker's Crossing. Ayavah is a stalwart supporter of the PCs, but her priority is the people of Xin-Eurythnia, and she continues to speak on their behalf throughout the rest of the campaign. Though the PCs must eventually leave the refugees behind in their fight against the Trinity Star cult, they can rest assured knowing Xin-Eurythnia's people are well cared for.

Once the PCs move on to the next adventure in the Revenge of the Runelords Adventure Path, Ayavah's direct and scripted role in the unfolding events grows more vague. She shouldn't simply disappear from the story, especially if any of the PCs have formed a strong attachment to her. She could continue to provide advice or updates to the PCs about the refugees in Vekker's Crossing through the use of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yM3KTTSAIHhyuP14]{Dream Message} spells (or even after securing a wand of sending to be able to send more urgent messages that don't require dreaming). If she keeps regular contact with the PCs in this way, if the party finds themselves in danger, she can send a rescue team to pull them out of the fire, but a better use for her messages would be as a way to guide the PCs forward should they ever come to a point where they've lost the plot.
